tags.name: plus-accordion

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Control the element to expand or not.

attributes.name: summary
attributes.description: The summary text displayed on the header.

tags.description: A vertically stacked list of headers that reveal or hide associated sections of content.

attributes.name: persistent
attributes.description: Specifies that only one accordion can be open.

tags.name: plus-animation

attributes.name: composite
attributes.description: Determines how values are combined between this animation and other, separate animations that do not specify their own specific composite operation.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Whether the animation runs forwards (`normal`), backwards (`reverse`), switches direction after each iteration (`alternate`), or runs backwards and switches direction after each iteration (`alternate-reverse`).

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete. Keep in mind that your animation will not run if this value is 0.

attributes.name: easing
attributes.description: The rate of the animation's change over time. Accepts the pre-defined values "`linear`", "`ease`", "`ease-in`", "`ease-out`", and "`ease-in-out`", or a custom "`cubic-bezier`" value like "`cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1)`".

attributes.name: end-delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the end of an animation. This is primarily of use when sequencing animations based on the end time of another animation.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: Dictates whether the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s) prior to playing ("`backwards`"), retained after the animation has completed playing ("`forwards`"), or `both`.

attributes.name: iteration-composite
attributes.description: Determines how values build from iteration to iteration in this animation. Can be set to `accumulate` or `replace`.

attributes.name: iterations
attributes.description: The number of times the animation should repeat. And can also take a value of [Infinity](https://mdn.io/infinity) to make it repeat for as long as the element exists.

attributes.name: iteration-start
attributes.description: Describes at what point in the iteration the animation should start. 0.5 would indicate starting halfway through the first iteration for example, and with this value set, an animation with 2 iterations would end halfway through a third iteration.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Specifies what kind of animation will play. The list of available animations is [here](/element/animation/names).

tags.description: Creates an animation and applies it to the content. Powered by the [Web Animations API](https://mdn.io/web-animations-api). A wide range of animations is available [here](https://www.htmlplus.io/element/animation/names).

tags.name: plus-app-progress-bar

attributes.name: minimum
attributes.description: Determines the minimum percentage used upon starting, which must be a value between `0.0` and `1.0`.

attributes.name: trickle-disabled
attributes.description: Turn off the automatic incrementing behavior by setting this to `true`.

attributes.name: trickle-rate
attributes.description: The rate at which the progress bar increments when trickling.

attributes.name: trickle-speed
attributes.description: Adjust how often to trickle/increment, in ms.

tags.description: A progress bar that offers clear and intuitive visual feedback on the status of asynchronous operations.

tags.name: plus-avatar

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: Specifies the shape of the element.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Specifies the size of the element.

tags.description: An image representing a user's profile picture.

attributes.name: hoverable
attributes.description: Specifies whether to prominent the avatar when the mouse is entered or not.

attributes.name: stacked
attributes.description: Specifies whether avatars should be displayed compressed or not.

tags.name: plus-breadcrumb

attributes.name: expander-text
attributes.description: Specifies the label for the expander button.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: Specifies the position of the expander button. The expander button is displayed when the number of items reached the maximum limit.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Specifies the Maximum number of items that are allowed to be displayed.

tags.description: Breadcrumb element is a navigation pattern that shows the actual path of the current page. It represents the route using links, which enables the user to easily navigate upwards through the hierarchy.

tags.name: plus-browse

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: One or more [unique file type specifiers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/file#unique_file_type_specifiers) describing file types to allow.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum number of files.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum number of files.

attributes.name: min-size
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum size of the file(s) in bytes.

attributes.name: max-size
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum size of the file(s) in bytes.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Allows to select more than one file.

tags.description: Allows you to select file or files by using click or drag & drop functionality.

tags.name: plus-card

attributes.name: elevation
attributes.description: If you want the card to have shadow, use the elevation property, And select the property value between `1` and `24`.

attributes.name: flat
attributes.description: Use the flat property to neutralize elevation.

attributes.name: outlined
attributes.description: If you want the card to have border, use the outlined property.

attributes.name: tile
attributes.description: Use tile property to neutralize border-radius.

tags.description: Cards contain content and actions about a single subject.

tags.name: plus-carousel

attributes.name: align
attributes.description: Align the slides relative to the carousel viewport.

attributes.name: auto-height
attributes.description: Enables the height of the carousel container to be adjusted to match the tallest slide in view. This element provides a built-in implementation of Embla's `Auto Height` plugin, so there's no need to include the original plugin manually.

attributes.name: classes
attributes.description: Enables automatic class injection for styling based on carousel state. This element provides a built-in implementation of Embla's `Class Names` plugin, so there's no need to include the original plugin manually.

attributes.name: contain-scroll
attributes.description: Clear leading and trailing empty space that causes excessive scrolling. Use `trimSnaps` to only use snap points that trigger scrolling or `keepSnaps` to keep them. **Note**: When this is active, it will **override alignments** applied by the **align** property for enough slides at the **start** and the **end** of the carousel, in order to **cover** the **leading** and **trailing space**.

attributes.name: draggable
attributes.description: Enables scrolling the carousel using mouse and touch interactions.

attributes.name: drag-threshold
attributes.description: Drag threshold in pixels. This only affects **when** clicks are fired and not. In contrast to other carousel libraries, it will **not affect when dragging** of the carousel **starts**. **Note**: Browsers handle touch events differently than mouse events. Browsers won't fire the click event when a touch event includes an accidental slight swipe gesture. This is why this threshold only works for mouse events.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: Set scroll duration when triggered by any of the API methods. Higher numbers enables slower scrolling. Drag interactions are not affected because duration is then determined by the drag force. **Note**: Duration is **not** in milliseconds because Embla uses an attraction physics simulation when scrolling instead of easings. Only values between `20-60` are recommended.

attributes.name: focusable
attributes.description: Enables automatic focus event watching on slides. When enabled, fires a slideFocus event and scrolls to the focused slide.

attributes.name: in-view-threshold
attributes.description: This is the Intersection Observer [threshold](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API#creating_an_intersection_observer) option that will be applied to all slides.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: Enables infinite looping by translating slides to create a seamless loop. Automatically disables if slide content is insufficient to prevent glitches.

attributes.name: plugins
attributes.description: Pass Embla [plugins](https://www.embla-carousel.com/plugins) to extend carousel functionality.

attributes.name: mirror
attributes.description: Matches the current slide on another carousel using its id.

attributes.name: mirror-type
attributes.description: Specifies how the carousel should be mirrored onto another carousel.

attributes.name: resizable
attributes.description: Watches the **container** and **slides** for size changes and runs reInit when any size has changed.

attributes.name: slides-to-scroll
attributes.description: Group slides together. Drag interactions, dot navigation, and previous/next buttons are mapped to group slides into the given number, which has to be an integer. Set it to `auto` if you want to group slides automatically.

attributes.name: start-index
attributes.description: Set the initial scroll snap to the given number. First snap index starts at 0. Please note that this is not necessarily equal to the number of slides when used together with the `slidesToScroll` property.

attributes.name: tween-factor-base
attributes.description: Sets the base multiplier for the `--plus-carousel-factor-*` CSS variables used in visual transitions. This allows you to create dynamic slide effects such as scaling or fading. For example, setting this value enables effects like: - [Scale](https://www.embla-carousel.com/examples/predefined/#scale) - [Opacity](https://www.embla-carousel.com/examples/predefined/#opacity) The value affects how strongly the visual transformation is applied relative to the slide's position in the carousel.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: Provides a visual style variant for the carousel. Can be used to conditionally apply CSS themes or variants.

attributes.name: overrides
attributes.description: TODO: Indicates whether the carousel has been successfully initialized.

tags.description: A carousel element for cycling through elementsâ€”like images or text slides.

attributes.name: jump
attributes.description: Determines whether the carousel instantly jumps to the target slide or transitions smoothly.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies whether the button is 'previous', 'next', or a `number` for navigating to a specific slide.

attributes.name: template
attributes.description: A customizable template string for displaying the carousel's slide counter. This template supports two placeholders that will be dynamically replaced: - `%CURRENT%`: Represents the number of the currently active slide. - `%TOTAL%`: Represents the total number of slides in the carousel.

attributes.name: clickable
attributes.description: Controls what happens when you click an indicator. If `true`, it smoothly moves to the slide, and if set to `jump`, it instantly jumps without animation.

attributes.name: infinity
attributes.description: Allows indicators to wrap around the carousel when reaching the beginning or end.

attributes.name: numbers
attributes.description: Displays slide numbers inside the indicators.

attributes.name: clickable
attributes.description: Enables slide navigation when the slide is clicked. - If set to `true`, clicking the slide scrolls it smoothly to the nearest snap point. - If set to `'jump'`, clicking the slide instantly jumps to the snap point without animation. When the parent carousel has looping enabled, the slide will navigate via the shortest path to the target snap point.

tags.name: plus-center

attributes.name: inline
attributes.description: Converts the `display` CSS property from `flex` to `inline-flex`.

tags.description: Centers content vertically and horizontally.

tags.name: plus-click-outside

attributes.name: capture
attributes.description: A boolean value indicating that events of this type will be dispatched to the registered `listener` before being dispatched to any `EventTarget` beneath it in the DOM tree.

tags.description: Detects when a click event happens outside of itself.

tags.name: plus-counter

attributes.name: easing
attributes.description: Easing function. Click [here](http://robertpenner.com/easing) for more details.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: Delay in milliseconds before starting the transition.

tags.description: Can be used to quickly create animations that display numerical data in a more interesting way.

tags.name: plus-cropper

attributes.name: area
attributes.description: A number between 0 and 1. Specifies the automatic cropping area size.

attributes.name: aspect-ratio
attributes.description: Specifies the initial aspect ratio of the viewport.

attributes.name: background
attributes.description: Shows the grid background of the container.

attributes.name: guides
attributes.description: Shows the dashed lines above the viewport.

attributes.name: indicator
attributes.description: Shows the center indicator above the viewport.

attributes.name: resizer
attributes.description: Enables to resize the viewport by dragging (Works when the value of the `mode` property is `crop`).

attributes.name: resizer-shape
attributes.description: Specifies the shape of the resizer.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: Specifies the shape of the viewport.

attributes.name: transparent
attributes.description: Hides the black modal above the image and under the viewport.

attributes.name: zoom-ratio
attributes.description: Specifies zoom ratio when zooming the image by wheeling the mouse.

tags.description: Used for cropping large images to fit a container before uploading them to the server.

tags.name: plus-dialog

attributes.name: connector
attributes.description: This property helps you to attach which dialog toggler controls the dialog. It doesn't matter where the dialog toggler is. You can put the dialog's toggler inside or outside of the dialog. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

attributes.name: full-height
attributes.description: Set the height of the dialog as much as the screen's height.

attributes.name: full-width
attributes.description: Set the width of the dialog as much as the screen's width.

attributes.name: fullscreen
attributes.description: Set both width and height of the dialog to occupy the screen size.

attributes.name: keyboard
attributes.description: Closes the dialog when `escape` key is pressed.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Control dialog to show or not.

attributes.name: persistent
attributes.description: It prevents the dialog from closing on clicking outside of the element.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Specifies where to show the dialog box by choosing two values, one for horizontal and another for vertical. Horizontal has a range of `left`, `center`, `right`, `start`, `end`, and vertical values are `top`, `center` and `bottom`.

attributes.name: scrollable
attributes.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Determine the width of the dialog.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description: Removes the margin around the dialog's content.

attributes.name: transparent
attributes.description: Deactivate the dialog's backdrop to show or not.

tags.description: A dialog is a `conversation` between the system and the user. It is prompted when the system needs input from the user or to give the user urgent information concerning their current workflow.

attributes.name: scrollable
attributes.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

attributes.name: scrollable
attributes.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

attributes.name: connector
attributes.description: This property helps you to attach which dialog this toggler controls. It doesn't matter where the dialog toggler is. You can put the dialog's toggler inside or outside of the dialog. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

tags.name: plus-divider

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Draws the divider in a `horizontal` or `vertical` orientation.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Specifies the location of the default slot.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Specifies the thickness of the border.

attributes.name: stroke
attributes.description: Specifies the style of the border.

tags.description: A thin line that divides the content vertically or horizontally.

tags.name: plus-drawer

attributes.name: backdrop
attributes.description: Activate the drawer's backdrop to show or not. It works when floating is activated.

attributes.name: connector
attributes.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer toggler controls the drawer. It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is. You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

attributes.name: floating
attributes.description: On default the drawer is considered as a part of the main container. it pushes the other contents on opening. If true it will be opened over other contents and doesn't affect other contents. A floating drawer sits above its application and uses a backdrop to darken the background.

attributes.name: mini
attributes.description: Set the width of drawer to the minimum size you specified for the `mini-size` property.

attributes.name: mini-size
attributes.description: Sets the minimum width size of the drawer.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Control drawer to show or not.

attributes.name: persistent
attributes.description: If true, don't allow the drawer to be closed by clicking outside of the drawer. If false, the drawer will be closed by clicking outside of it.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Specifies where the drawer will open.

attributes.name: flexible
attributes.description: It controls the flexibility of the drawer's width. If yes, the width of the drawer can be reduced. If false doesn't allow the width of the drawer to reduce.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Determine the width of the drawer.

tags.description: This element lets you add collapsible side contents like navigation alongside some primary content.

attributes.name: connector
attributes.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer this toggler controls. It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is. You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

tags.name: plus-faker

attributes.name: arguments
attributes.description: Specifies the API's arguments as an array.

tags.description: Generates massive amounts of fake (but realistic) data for testing and development. Powered by [Faker](https://fakerjs.dev/).

tags.name: plus-format-bytes

attributes.name: display
attributes.description: Specifies the unit will be shown as an abbreviation or not.

attributes.name: decimals
attributes.description: Specifies the number of decimal places. Use an array to specify the minimum and maximum.

attributes.name: separator
attributes.description: Specifies the separator between number and unit.

attributes.name: signed
attributes.description: Shows plus sign for positive numbers. If the difference is exactly zero a space character will be prepended instead for better alignment.

attributes.name: standard
attributes.description: Specifies the standard of units. [Metric and IEC](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte) are supported.

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: Specifies the unit in which the result will be returned.

tags.description: Converts bytes to a human-readable string. [Metric and IEC](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte) standard are supported.

tags.name: plus-icon

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Specifies an alternate description to use for assistive devices.

attributes.name: resolver
attributes.description: An asynchronous function to load SVG files.

tags.description: A graphical representation of an action, object, or idea that is used in a user interface to provide visual cues and improve the user experience. All icons are based on the popular [Bootstrap Icons](https://icons.getbootstrap.com) library.

tags.name: plus-intersection

attributes.name: root
attributes.description: The element that is used as the viewport for checking visibility of the target. Must be the ancestor of the target. Defaults to the browser viewport if not specified or if `null`.

attributes.name: root-margin
attributes.description: Margin around the root. Can have values similar to the CSS [margin](https://mdn.io/margin) property, e.g. `"10px 20px 30px 40px"` (top, right, bottom, left). The values can be percentages. This set of values serves to grow or shrink each side of the root element's bounding box before computing intersections. Defaults to all zeros.

attributes.name: threshold
attributes.description: Either a single number or an array of numbers which indicate at what percentage of the target's visibility the observer's callback should be executed. If you only want to detect when visibility passes the 50% mark, you can use a value of 0.5. If you want the callback to run every time visibility passes another 25%, you would specify the array [0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1]. The default is 0 (meaning as soon as even one pixel is visible, the callback will be run). A value of 1.0 means that the threshold isn't considered passed until every pixel is visible.

tags.description: The [Intersection Observer API](https://mdn.io/intersection-observer-api) provides a way to asynchronously observe changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's [viewport](https://mdn.io/glossary-viewport).

tags.name: plus-prism

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: The theme to apply for syntax highlighting.

attributes.name: sync
attributes.description: Whether to synchronize updates with DOM changes.

attributes.name: resolver
attributes.description: A custom resolver function to load Prism assets (e.g., languages, themes, plugins).

tags.description: Syntax highlighting for code snippets, supporting multiple programming languages and offering customizable themes. Powered by [PrismJS](https://prismjs.com/).

tags.name: plus-progress-bar

attributes.name: buffer
attributes.description: Specifies the secondary progress of the bar by a number between `min` and `max`.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: Specifies the color of the bar.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum value of the progress.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum value of the progress.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Specifies the progress of the bar by a number between `min` and `max`.

tags.description: Progress bar expresses an unspecified wait time or display the length of a process.

tags.name: plus-relative-time

attributes.name: format
attributes.description: The format style for the relative time.

attributes.name: numeric
attributes.description: Determines whether the numeric value should always be displayed.

attributes.name: sync
attributes.description: Determines whether the relative time should be updated automatically.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The date and time to be displayed in a relative format.

tags.description: Outputs a localized time phrase relative to the provided datetime.

tags.name: plus-scroll-detector

attributes.name: reference
attributes.description: Specifies the reference of the scroll.

attributes.name: vertical
attributes.description: Indicates which scroll (horizontal or vertical) is to be used as the source.

tags.description: Detects scroll event from an element.

tags.name: plus-signature

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: Specifies the color of the strokes.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: Specifies the distance between the previous point and the next one.

attributes.name: dot-size
attributes.description: Specifies the radius of a single dot.

attributes.name: max-width
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum width of the strokes.

attributes.name: min-width
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum width of the strokes.

attributes.name: resizable
attributes.description: Observes the element dimensions to apply new changes on the canvas.

attributes.name: throttle
attributes.description: Specifies the time distance between the previous point and the next one.

attributes.name: velocity
attributes.description: Specifies the velocity based on the previous velocity.

attributes.name: redoable
attributes.description: Specifies whether redo can be performed or not.

attributes.name: undoable
attributes.description: Specifies whether undo can be performed or not.

tags.description: Allows user to draw smooth signatures.

tags.name: plus-snippet
tags.description: A component that can be used to display inline code snippets.

tags.name: plus-spinner

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Specifies the size of the spinner.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies which variant of the spinner to use.

tags.description: An indicator of progress and activity.

tags.name: plus-stack

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: The alignment of items along the cross axis.

attributes.name: justify
attributes.description: The distribution of items along the main axis.

attributes.name: reverse
attributes.description: Whether to reverse the order of items.

attributes.name: wrap
attributes.description: Controls whether items should wrap onto multiple lines.

tags.description: A container for arranging elements vertically or horizontally.

tags.name: plus-sticky

attributes.name: watcher
attributes.description: To active `state` attribute, `change` event, `normal` slot, or `stick` slot, Set it to `true`.

tags.description: Element content is positioned based on the user's scroll position.

tags.name: plus-switch

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Puts the switch in checked state.

tags.description: Toggles the state of a single item on or off.

tags.name: plus-tabs

attributes.name: vertical
attributes.description: You can use vertical property for vertical mode.

tags.description: Organizes content across different screens.

tags.name: plus-tabs-bar

attributes.name: grow
attributes.description: Grows tabs as much as all available space (occupies all horizontal space).

attributes.name: justify
attributes.description: Specifies how the tabs are aligned.

attributes.name: reverse
attributes.description: Reverses the arrangement of the tabs.

tags.description: TODO: Arranges tabs within a bar.

tags.name: plus-tabs-panel
tags.description: TODO: This element contains the contents of each tab and when the tab is activated the panel is displayed.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: A Tab can be disabled by setting disabled property.

tags.name: plus-tooltip

attributes.name: arrow
attributes.description: Specifies whether to display the arrow or not.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: Specifies a delay in milliseconds for show or hide. Use a number for both show and hide or create an array of two separate numbers for show and hide.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Specifies the display location of the element relative to the reference.

attributes.name: reference
attributes.description: Specifies the element to which the tooltip will be attached. Use `next` to attach to the next sibling. Use `parent` to attach to the parent. Use `previous` to attach to the previous sibling. Use a string to find an element to attach to that. Use an element to attach to that.
